HOUSE COMMITTEES

HIGHER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION

 

JURISDICTION: All matters directly and principally relating to post secondary and tertiary education, technical education, distance education, students, and teachers, welfare, and centers of excellence.

CHAIRPERSON :

Go, Mark O.

District Representative
Baguio City, Lone District

 
  • COMMITTEE MEMBERS
  • PRIMARY REFERRAL
  • SECONDARY REFERRAL
  • MEETINGS

HB07381
[History] [Text As Filed]
 

Significance: N

Date Filed: 2023-03-01

Full Title, As Filed: AN ACT TO DEVELOP AND STRENGTHEN THE AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN THE COUNTRY THROUGH THE INSTITUTIONALIZATION OF MANPOWER DEVELOPMENT FOR AGRICULTURAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP AT THE POST-SECONDARY LEVEL

HR01005
[History] [Text As Filed]

HR00253
[History] [Text As Filed]
 

Date Filed: 2022-08-16

Full Title, As Filed: RESOLUTION CONDEMNING THE RED-TAGGING COMMITTED BY SEVERAL COMMISSIONERS OF THE KOMISYON SA WIKANG FILIPINO (KWF) AND OF THE SONSHINE MEDIA NETWORK INTERNATIONAL NEWS OF SEVERAL AUTHORS AND THEIR WORKS AND THE ILLEGAL BOOK PURGING ORDERED BY THE KWF

Principal Author/s: 1. CASTRO, FRANCE L.2. BROSAS, ARLENE D.3. MANUEL, RAOUL DANNIEL A.

Date Read: 2022-08-17

Bill Status: Pending with the Committee on BASIC EDUCATION AND CULTURE since 2022-08-17

SCHEDULE OF MEETINGS

Unless otherwise indicated, all committee meeting venues are located at the House of Representatives Complex.


Select Week
 

19-FEBRUARY-2024 • MONDAY
Committee/Sub-CommitteeTime and Venue
BASIC EDUCATION AND CULTURE jt. w/ HIGHER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION
Agenda		10:00 AM
Face-face meeting at the Spkr. Belmonte Hall 1/F SWA Bldg. (To be livestreamed on the official Facebook pages of the HRep, Pasig City Rep. Roman Romulo, and Baguio City Rep. Mark O. Go)
HB 6908 – Providing for universal educational assistance to all pre-elementary, primary, secondary, and tertiary students in the Philippines (Rep. Gerville ‘Jinky Bitrics’ Luistro)

HBs 8960, 9770 & 9808 – Ensuring that Senior High School (SHS) graduates under the K to 12 Program are equipped with the knowledge, training and skills demanded in the labor market, enhancing their employability and competitiveness, creating the Batang Magaling Councils to strengthen multi-stakeholder collaboration and support for their employment, allowing full deduction of training expenses incurred for their skills development, appropriating funds therefor (Reps. Gus Tambunting, Stella Luz Quimbo, and Deputy Speaker Camille Villar)

HB 8242 – Granting free assessment fee for SHS students under the SHS training-vocational- livelihood track and other SHS tracks requiring certifications, and appropriating funds therefor (Rep. Doris Maniquiz)
• In consolidation with the previously approved HBs 8960, 9770 and 9808 or the Batang Magaling Act

LEGISLATIVE CALENDAR
NINETEENTH CONGRESS, SECOND REGULAR SESSON

HOUSE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION NO. 16

Introduced by Representatives
Manuel Jose "Mannix" M. Dalipe and Marcelino C. Libanan

CONCURRENT RESOLUTION

PROVIDING FOR THE LEGISLATIVE CALENDAR FOR THE SECOND REGULAR SESSION OF THE NINETEENTH CONGRESS OF THE PHILIPPINES

RESOLVED BY THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES, THE SENATE CONCURRING, That the Legislative Calendar for the Second Regular Session of the Nineteenth Congress of the Philippines shall be as follows:

 

CALENDAR OF SESSION
SECOND REGULAR SESSION

1. Commencement of Session July 24, 2023 - September 29, 2023
2. Adjournment of Session September 30, 2023 - November 5, 2023
3. Resumption of Session November 6, 2023 - December 15, 2023
4. Adjournment of Session December 16, 2023 - January 21, 2024
5. Resumption of Session January 22, 2024 - March 22, 2024
6. Adjournment of Session March 23, 2024 - April 28, 2024
7. Resumption of Session April 29, 2024 - May 24, 2024
(Sine Die Adjournment)
8. Adjournment of Session May 25, 2024 - July 21, 2024
